page.title: 20VEGETABLES IN THE VALE
page.content: A great many growers have small parcels of land, ranging from five to twenty acres. Tractors, Merrytillers and even horses are used on the land. Irrigation is from the river and brooks, whilst spray lines have to be regularly moved. The most popular winter crops are brussel sprouts and leeks, whilst runner beans, peas and courgettes do well in summer. A local greengrocer buys most of his produce from the wholesale markets in Evesham; the more exotic fruits from London. Pineapples, kiwi fruit, and melons are delivered twice a week. His day starts at seven o'clock and finishes at half past five. His busiest days are Fridays and Saturdays. Although cabbage is grown locally the most popular vegetables are cauliflowers and carrots which come from other areas.
